content.description: Five feet below Blade Runner corner, climb past some crystals and then up and right onto a face covered with Lichen.
content.protection: top rope set slightly further downstream than for the other climbs
content.location: starts and lower most part of descent to the main slab

content.description: Follow the obvious crack past the juniper tree and over left either to the large undercling or large corner exit.
content.location: Halfway down the descent to the main slab base, just above a big boulder.

content.description: Go right at the crux of Blade Runner following under cling and then up face.
content.location: starts 5' below corner at some large crystals

content.description: Follow the corner below the belay ledge, stepping right to reach for some crystals, and then up the face past a sharply cut crack.
content.location: corner begins just below the belay ledge

content.description: Sunny and secluded. There is a fair amount of top roping off three rope points.  When the water is low, it is possible to reach the buttress routes off the main rock resting the the river.  Otherwise, one slab, the upstream one, is long and fourth, with fifth class top ropes up the right hand or downstream side.  The other slab, slightly downstream, is reached by a 3rd class descent from the top between the two main slabs.  A top rope anchor directly above the ledge belay stance at the bottom of the descent allows a series of interesting top ropes.  Shove the anchor over eight feet from the obvious corner, and the routes on the right slab over the water are possible.  Dave's sketch illustrates most of the options on the right hand side of this slab, as does the photo with lines drawn in.
